alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 02 at 9:48PM EST until March 04 at 12:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow likely. Isolated thunderstorms possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with isolated higher amounts around 10 inches. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northern Indiana, southwest Michigan and northwest Ohio. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially by midday. The hazardous conditions will impact primarily the evening commute. The combination of gusty winds and heavy, wet snow could bring down tree branches and lead to power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates in excess of 1 inch per hour are expected.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
